Package io.zivoric.enchantmentcore

Class CustomEnch

java.lang.Object
org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment
io.zivoric.enchantmentcore.CustomEnch
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.kyori.adventure.translation.Translatable, org.bukkit.Keyed
Direct Known Subclasses:
PaperCustomEnch
public abstract class CustomEnch extends org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment

Represents a custom enchantment handled by ZEnchantmentCore.

This class can be extended to create a new custom enchantment to be handled by ZEnchantmentCore. The superconstructor must be passed an EnchantmentHolder, which holds the enchantment before it is registered in minecraft, and a String representing the internal ID of the enchantment.

See Also:
EnchantmentHolder

    • getPriority

      public int getPriority()

      Returns the priority of the enchantment, starting at zero (higher is more important).

      Enchantments with higher priorities will be loaded before enchantments with lower priorities.

      Returns:
      The priority of the enchantment

    • getCoreID

      public int getCoreID()

      Gets the numeric ID of the custom enchantment, starting at 0.
      The order of the IDs depend on the order of instantiation of the enchantments.

      Returns:
      The numeric ID of the enchantment

    • isDisabled

      public boolean isDisabled()

      Checks if the enchantment is disabled.

      Returns:
      true if disabled; false otherwise.

      public final Set<org.bukkit.inventory.EquipmentSlot> getEquipmentSlot()

      Returns:
      List containing all applicable equipment slots
      See Also:

    • getModifiedMin

      public int getModifiedMin​(int enchLevel)

      Parameters:
      enchLevel - The power of the enchantment
      Returns:

    • getName

      public String getName()

      Gets the internal name of this enchantment in upper case.

      The name of the enchantment in normal case is equal to Enchantment.getKey().getKey().

      Specified by:
      getName in class org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment
      Returns:
      The internal name of the enchantment
      See Also:
      Enchantment.getKey()

    • isLenient

      public boolean isLenient()

      Determines whether or not the enchantment is lenient in its enchanting capability.

      This affects the following conditions:

      • If Enchantment.getItemTarget() == WEAPON, whether it will enchant axes by default or not
      Returns:
      true if the enchantment conditions are lenient; false otherwise.
      See Also:
      Enchantment.getItemTarget(), canEnchantItem(ItemStack)

    • conflictsWith

      public final boolean conflictsWith​(org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment other)

      Checks if this enchantment conflicts with another specified enchantment.

      This method is used in enchantment algorithms and cannot be overridden, unlike isCompatibleWith(Enchantment).

      Specified by:
      conflictsWith in class org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment
      Parameters:
      other - The enchantment to check against
      Returns:
      true if there is a conflict; false otherwise.
      See Also:
      isCompatibleWith(Enchantment)

      Returns:

    • isCursed

      public boolean isCursed()

      Checks if this enchantment is a cursed enchantment.

      A cursed enchantment will show up as red in the enchantment list rather than gray.

      Specified by:
      isCursed in class org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment
      Returns:
      true if the enchantment is cursed; false otherwise.

    • isTreasure

      public boolean isTreasure()

      Checks if this enchantment is a treasure enchantment.

      A treasure enchantment will only generate in loot tables and won't appear in enchantment tables by default.

      Specified by:
      isTreasure in class org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment
      Returns:
      true if the enchantment is a treasure enchantment; false otherwise.
